title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,

snippet: On the left, before descending to the coast, are considerable remains of a castle, called popularly the old castle, or Macduff's Castle.

title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: Near Dysart are the ruins of an exceedingly  old castle known as Macduff's Castle.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But others say, and I believe more truly, that the King, seeing that the Castleof Kennoway was very strong, and that Macduff hadescaped from him, and was embarked for England,departed back to Dunsinane without attempting totake Macduff's Castle of Kennoway.
